page.title: 20Village life in Ash
page.content:
{Ash}is a small village that has{litle {recent development.} Although the village school shut some twelve years ago and the village shop (also post office) finally closed five years ago there are still{two thriving pubs}in the village. The{church}flourishes and a{parish hall}is well used, the reason for these being associated with the development, since 1967, of{New {Ash Green}half a mile{to the north.
Reflecting what has been a{prosperous {community}the{houses}of the village are{larger than average}for their age and are set well apart. They straddle the road through the village with no side roads. Among the houses are examples of{Kentish shiplap boarding and also{flint construction.
Authors: The Parlett family
